edu.kit.scc.dem.wapsrv.model.formats

Class ContentNegotiator

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.kit.scc.dem.wapsrv.model.formats.ContentNegotiator

  • public final class ContentNegotiator
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements content negotiation based on the HTTP accept header field.

    If the field is not present or could not be processed, the default values are used. This complies to the protocol since servers are free to ignore client preferences regarding formats.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Matthias Dressel, Michael Hitzker, Markus Hoefler, Andreas Loeffler, Timo Schmidt

      Return a list of all recognized formatters the client requested ordered by client preference

      The Q value weight provided for the given formatter. 0.5 if none existed.

      • ContentNegotiator

        public ContentNegotiator(java.lang.String accept,
                         FormattableObject.Type type,
                         JsonLdProfileRegistry profileRegistry,
                         FormatRegistry formatRegistry)
        Constructs a new ContentNegotiater that processes the given accept header.
        Parameters:
        accept - The accept header. If null, default values are used
        type - The Type of object this accept headers belongs to (Container, Page, Annotation)
        profileRegistry - The JSON-LD profile registry to use
        formatRegistry - The format registry

    • Method Detail

      • isClientSelected

        public boolean isClientSelected()
        Returns whether the given accept header could be processed correctly
        Returns:
        true if valid, false otherwise

      • getAccept

        public java.lang.String getAccept()
        Returns the accept header as provided by the client
        Returns:
        The accept header, may be null

      • getFormatters

        public java.util.List<Formatter> getFormatters()
        Return a list of all recognized formatters the client requested ordered by client preference
        Returns:
        A list of all formatters

      • getFormatter

        public Formatter getFormatter()
        Returns the client's most wanted Formatter

        This either is the one with the highest Q-Rating, or if none are provided, the first in the list that can be used. If none of the client requests can be fulfilled, it is an instance of the DEFAULT_FORMATTER_CLASS

        Returns:
        The clients most wanted Formatter

      • getQValue

        public double getQValue(Formatter formatter)
        The Q value weight provided for the given formatter. 0.5 if none existed.
        Parameters:
        formatter - The formatter
        Returns:
        The formatters Q Value
